review_blob: Golden straw color with thin white head. Smells of biscuit and malt. Thin and dry palate. Mild clean taste. Almost no bitterness. Nice light pale ale.
Pours chestnut brown with thin vanilla head. Roasted malts, carmel, and clove aroma. Tastes of dark fruits and bretts. Medium body. A nice dark farmhouse ale.
Pours a dark roasted brown with vanilla head. Smells nutty and sweet. Medium/full body with tastes of malt and hay. Nice dunkel.
Funky fruit aroma. Clean golden appearance. Citrus and malty taste taste. Bitter throughout palate. Pretty good but a bit skunky.
Pours hazy golden with white frothy head. Smells of sweet smokey malts. A little dry on the tongue but pretty well balanced.
Pours a light bronze. Smells of must and funk. Smooth taste with a slight bitter finish. Nice full flavored IPA
Smells of malt, pine, and nuts. Pours hazy amber. Dry palate with light hops. Slightly bitter finish.
Pours clear yellow with thin head. Smells or corn and grain. Light hoppy taste with thin palate. Very sessionable.
Pours midnight black with vanilla cream head. Roasted malts and sweet chocolate. Tastes sweet and salty. Soft mouthfeel.Nice balanced beer.
beer_name: New Belgium / Three Floyds Lips Of Faith - Grtzer Ale

review_blob: Pours a hazy yellow with light frothy head. Smells of citrus hops with a bit of funk. Thin palate with a tart dry finish.
Pours a cloudy pineapple color. Smells and tastes sour. Sweet backbone with hints of peach. Medium body. Yum!
Pours clear pale golden.Sweet aroma with notes of citrus. Light palate with clean finish.
Pours clear copper with medium head. Funk and mild malt aroma. Full bodied with bitter notes. Good but definitely not a sessionable beer.
Pours a thick black with a vanilla cream head. Smells of malt and roasted espresso. Thick bitter sweet taste. A nice stout thats not too heavy.
Pours an amber orange with medium carbonation. Aroma is sweet malt with not much else. Dry with a small amout of hops with medium body. Nothing special but not a terrible marzen.
Pours a cloudy orange with a thick head. Smells of citrus and pine. Tastes of hops and grapefruit with a bit of sweet spice. Thick mouth feel with a dry palate. Nice addition to the 4 Hands line.

Pours thin with a clear orange appearance. Light aroma of pumpkin and vanilla. Tastes of moist pumpkin pie with tons of sweet spice. Medium body with a smooth finish. Highly recomend this seasonal brew.
Pours a hazy yellow with tons of carbonation. Smells sweet and crisp. Tastes tart and bready. Light palate with a dry finish. Light and sessionable.
Very bright yellow with thin carbonated head. Smells sweet and fruity. Semi dry and tart taste. Great thin palate that goes down smooth.
Pours a copper red with medium head. Aroma of malt and mandrin oranges. Tastes smoth and dry on the palate. Thin mouth feel. Very tasty!
Pours clear golden with thin head. Smells of hops, sweet fruit, and floral. Full bodied but not heavy on the palate. Nice dry bitterness with clean finish.
beer_name: Founders Backstage Series #10: Dissenter Imperial IPL

review_blob: Dark thick brown with vanilla head. Sweet boozy aroma. Medium body with dry palate up front. Very complex flavors throughout.
Pours with little medium carbonation and a clear raspberry color. A nice balance of sweet and tart. Light palate.
beer_name: Samuel Smiths Organic Raspberry Fruit Beer

review_blob: Poured from pint bottle. Clear golden yellow with mininimal carbonation with fast dissipation. Smells a little sour with notes of mandarin oranges. Thin palate with sweet notes and a dry finish. Good farmhouse ale.
Pours big carbonation with dark caramel brown appearance. Sweet palate with a medium body. Tastes of dark fruit with a boozey aftertaste. Very tasty
Pours clear light golden with thin head.sweet and fruity aroma. Crisp and refreshing with a light palate. Small hints of pear not very peppery though.

Pours a dark cloudy orange with low carbonation. Hints of fruit in aroma. Very unique flavor. Sweet and full bodied palate. Little traces of bourbon and orange zest. Great special release from 4 hands
Pours a cloudy golden with light head. Smells like a sour ale with more body. Light palate with dry finish. Drinkable but not very enjoyable.
Pours clear golden with medium head. Smells like citrus and hops.Great balanced palate. A very drinkable ale with smooth finish.
beer_name: Lagunitas A Little Sumpin Sumpin Ale

review_blob: Night black pour with thick vanilla head. Smells smokey and resin like.Medium body palate. Tastes of coffee grounds but in good way. Bitter in the front with a sweet and dry finish.
Pours dark brown color with a thick bubbly head. An aroma of oats and nuts. A light palate but surprisingly very complex flavor for not being heavy. Very sweet earthy taste. A delight!
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Grainstorm Black Rye IPA

review_blob: Pint pour. Clear golden in color with minimal carbonation. Smells sweet and floral. Medium body with lingering bitter aftertaste. Good APA
12 oz can. First time trying Evil Twin brewery. A typical pale ale. Nothing too special but still a very tasty ale.
Highly carbonated thick head. Aroma of bread and sweet fruit. Golden orange appearance. Light palate. Dry slightly tart flavor. A good seasonal from a local St. Louis brewery.
Bottle pour. A slight bitterness with a sweet aftertaste.A decent pale ale from a local st louis brewer.
Dark pour with dark cream colored head. Smells of chocolate and coffee. Smooth thin palate with a bitter taste towards the back of the tongue. I?m satisfied but not extremely impressed.
Clean copper appearance with low carbonation. Smells like sweet smokey apples. Thin palate with bitter boozy taste. Another fantastic beer from Founders!

Bottle pour. Thick frothy head with a golden orange appearance. Sweet yeast aroma. Thin palate with sour aftertaste. Lots of flavor but still feels watered down somehow. Still a balanced beer just not strong enough taste.
A very friendly beer top those who like something different from a major label. Not my first choice but goods from time to time

Bottle pour.Golden Amber color with thin head. Yeasty with a touch of roasted nuts. Thin palate with the taste of apricot and a sweet dry after note. Seems to be afraid to be too much of anything. Still good though.

beer_brewer_name: Leinenkugel Brewing Company (Tenth & Blake Beer Co.)
review_blob: UPDATED: APR 6, 2014
UPDATED: MAR 30, 2014
Fresh citrus taste. A little bitter bite aftertaste. Very refreshing for a warm day in the sun.
Pours thick and thick with a thin head. Smells of espresso beans and chocolate.Tastes of malt and liquorice. A tad bitter with a lingering a booze flavor. A great imperial stout for a cold night!
Pours heavy head. Appearance is a thick honey color. Smells of spices and floral. Bitter but not too dry so its a very even taste. Yum!
Pours thick with a medium head. Very dark brown in appearance. Tastes nutty with a hint of clove. A tasty oatmeal brown but not the best.
Pours a clear copper with medium head. Smells skunky with raisins. Medium palate with an earthy taste. Definitely a great pale ale!
beer_name: Deschutes Red Chair Northwest Pale Ale

review_blob: Pours clear golden with thin head that dissipates quickly. Tastes of dough with a sweet finish. A tasty beer!
Poured from pint bottle. Light golden color with light foamy head. A sweet bread aroma. Tastes of sweet grain with a citrus end. Overall a good Bavarian style lager.
UPDATED: FEB 7, 2014
